citations.narrative:
On December 12, 2022, at approximately 9:15 am, a zoo employee discovered that “Effie” a 10-plus-year-old female
raccoon, with microchip #00-06F3-DA28, escaped the Louisiana Swamp Exhibit through a hole dug under the enclosure
fence near the corner by the Swamp Café. According to the facility records, food, traps, and cameras were strategically
placed to monitor the area, (around and under the boardwalk), to try to catch or lure her back to the enclosure. Effie was
uneventfully recaptured and safely returned to the exhibit on December 19, 2022.
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals
from injury and to contain the animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
On December 12, 2022, at approximately 9:15 am, a zoo employee discovered that “Effie” a 10-plus-year-old female 
raccoon, with microchip #00-06F3-DA28, escaped the Louisiana Swamp Exhibit through a hole dug under the enclosure 
fence near the corner by the Swamp Café. According to the facility records, food, traps, and cameras were strategically 
placed to monitor the area, (around and under the boardwalk), to try to catch or lure her back to the enclosure.  Effie was 
uneventfully recaptured and safely returned to the exhibit on December 19, 2022.   
 
The facility must be constructed of such material and of such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor 
and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals 
from injury and to contain the animals. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
